fields.summary: Can't display web images as thumbnails :-(
fullscreen rte rendering breaks if user keeps scrolling up/down a lot or after reaching top/end of page

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Upload a doc file to Confluence
* Type ! and the filename to enter the viewdoc macro usign autocomplete

Expected: After inserting the macro, the user can continue typing text into the editor

Actual: In Safari, the cursor focus has been lost, so additional typed text is not entered into the editor. The user must first use the mouse to click back inside the editor.
fields.summary: after inserting a non-image file e.g. .pdf or .ppt, the RTE no longer has focus so I can't continue typing
if the last content on a page is a table row, positioning the cursor after it and presing enter/return in the RTE causes a new line to be created at the top of the page not the end
Autocomplete in Full Screen not working for IE browsers

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Add a link to a page with an alias of 2 words
* Use the context menu on the link, and select "unlink"


Expected: The entire link should become plain text

Actual: Only the word under the cursor is unlinked, the other word remains as a link.
fields.summary: Problems unlinking multi words in Safari

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Go to the RTE
# Type some text that will get search results
# Hit Ctrl-Sh-K to call the Autocomplete
# Select "Search for <text>"

The text is entered correctly in the Link Browser, results are displayed, and the first result is correctly selected, but the Insert button is disabled. Seems to work in Firefox, but Safari and IE are both affected.
fields.summary: Insert button is disabled in Link Browser after search triggered from RTE Autocomplete option

fields.description: Attached image from FF35.

fields.summary: User access logging missing for pages with double byte(Japanese) characters in page name
viewppt and viewpdf do not render properly within Sharepoint via Sharepoint Connector Confluence Page Webpart

fields.description:
See CONF-18876

Inserting a link inside quotes or parentheses is a fairly common use case.

However, inserting an image is not. Therefore the autocomplete should not be triggered is typing a string such as (!)
fields.summary: Autocomplete: Trigger character for images should not work after parentheses and quotes
New Keyboard Shortcuts

fields.description: The configuration dialogue for the JIRA gadget that displays a confluence activity stream has a field with a misleading title. Unless you read the fine print, the field labelled "username" is easily misinterpreted as "enter *your* user name here". Since the field is meant to select a username to display updates for, I would recommend a label such as "user to watch" or something similar.
fields.summary: Rename "username" field for confluence activity stream JIRA gadget

fields.description:
In the section for [Importing Web Content|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Importing+Content+Into+Confluence#ImportingContentIntoConfluence-ImportingWebContent] there is a bullet for:
* Convert a HTML file to a Confluence page using the [HTML To Confluence Converter plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/HTML+To+Confluence+Converter].

However, the [link|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/HTML+To+Confluence+Converter] leads to a page that is restricted. I'd fix it myself but I don't know which page it should go to.
fields.summary: Link on "Importing Content Into Confluence" page is broken

fields.description:
To replicate:
 - Edit a page in the RTE
 - Type some text (without pressing enter)
 - Click the 'Insert Image' icon and pick any image. You will see the image appears on the line _after_ that the cursor was on:
!img_rte.png!
Now click Preview. You'll see the image is displayed alongside the text:
!img_preview.png!
ie. the newline shown in the RTE doesn't actually exist, as can be confirmed by switching to markup mode.
fields.summary: Image inserted in RTE displays on new line, but not when saved

fields.description:
In [our docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+For+SQL+Server#KnownIssuesForSQLServer-UnicodeCharactersNotSupportedByDefault] we state:

{quote}
h2. Unicode Characters Not Supported By Default

*Problem*
Non-ASCII characters will not be displayed by Confluence.

*Reason*
The default SQL Server dialect uses column types that do not support Unicode, specifically the *char*, *varchar* and *text* column types. See [CONF-4786|CONF-4786@JIRA] for details.

*Solution*
To add Unicode support, use the Unicode SQL Server dialect which uses *nchar*, *nvarchar* and *ntext* column types. Unicode SQL Server dialect has the downside of halving the maximum length of each column from 8000 characters to 4000, as every char is stored in two bytes.

Enable Unicode SQL Server dialect on a new setup, perform these steps prior to 'Stage 3 - Database Connection Setup' of the [Database Setup For Any External Database]:
# Open the *<confluence installation folder>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\database-defaults\mssql.properties* file within your Confluence installation folder. In version 2.6 onwards, this file is located in the {{/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence.x.x.x.jar}} file. Jar files are similar to zip formats, so you may need to extract the {{mssql.properties}} file and place it in {{\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\database-defaults\}}. You can create the {{database-defaults}} directory if it does not exist.
# Comment the line: _dialect=net.sf.hibernate.dialect.SQLServerDialect_
# Uncomment the line: _\#dialect=net.sf.hibernate.dialect.SQLServerIntlDialect_
# Start the Confluence Setup Wizard

For existing SQL Server instances wishing to enable Unicode support:
# From Confluence, create an XML site backup
# From your DBA tool, create a full backup of the Confluence schema contents
# Stop Confluence
# Move your home directory
# Drop all tables from the Confluence schema
# Change the dialect to Unicode using the above instructions
# Follow the 'Stage 3 - Database Connection Setup' of [Database Setup For Any External Database] to setup the connection again and import the XML backup
# Once the Setup Wizard is complete, stop Confluence
# Copy any customised content and plugins from your old home directory into the new home directory
# Start Confluence

{quote}

We should really set this by default. Is there a reason we do not?
fields.summary: Why don't we make SQL server use the UNICODE character by default?
Editing the PDF Stylesheet documentation needs some correction

fields.description:
To reproduce:
* Add a page in a personal space with paragraphs of text.
* Make sure that the sidebar is expanded
* Add a comment


See screenshot.

It works fine in IE6 and IE8.
fields.summary: Fixed Width Theme: Adding a comment in a personal space will cause text to overlap the sidebar in IE7

fields.description:
See screenshot attached.

I assume this is also broken for IE6.
fields.summary: Markup Editor in IE7 is not aligned

fields.description:
CONF-18894 is caused by the autocomplete using the "old" way of getting REST attachments (e.g. rest/prototype/1/content/950394.json?expand=attachments&attachmentType=image%2Cword%2Cexcel). It would be fixed by using the new content/950394/attachments.json?attachmentType=image%2Cword%2Cexcel style but the /attachments uses the description string instead of the Attachment.Type enum value. 

The search call uses the values correctly : rest/prototype/1/search.json?type=attachment&attachmentType=image%2Cword%2Cexcel%2Cpdf%2Cpowerpoint&search=name&query=cl but comma-separates the types when they should be passed as separate parameters.

By using the correct parts of both methods consistently :

# Pass the attachmentType param as a case-insensitive string matching the Attachment.Type enum name, and
# Pass the attachmentTypes as a collection rather than a comma-separated string

we should avoid similar issues to CONF-18894 in the future.
fields.summary: REST attachmentType filtering is inconsistent and causing Autocomplete bugs

fields.description: We're getting {{section: You must enclose all content within your section macro with column macros.}}
fields.summary: PowerPoint Templates page in the demo space doesn't render properly
Missing space key causes confluence to show a generic error message.

fields.description:
Throws an error page about needing to use {section} macro when using the {column} macros.  Problem is that the section macros are in there correctly.

These last two beta upgrades are killing our reporting pages (along with the [problems with the future macro|CONF-18702])!  I'm being penalized for building cool pages with useful macros.  :-)

* [Example 1|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/PS/Phone+Activity+Reporting]
* [Example 2|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/PS/Sales+Engineering+Dashboard]

fields.description:
I am assuming that the REST service is slow. it takes 3 to 4s on eac, while all the other service calls take 1s or so. 

I occasionally get the timeout box (which, incidentally, looks broken too)
fields.summary: Showing attached images in autocomplete occasionally times out, and is overall slow compared to the other operations

fields.description:
*Description*:
Confluence Server will bend to its knees, CPU goes to 100% as the Office Connector tries to parse the date macro in the xlsx.

Attached is a sample of this file with only one row and one column containing the date macro.

h4. Workaround

Disable the view* macro via Administration > Plugins > Office Connector

Alternatively Download the [1.6.2|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/221?versionId=24952] version of the plugin which has this fix and [CONF-19674|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-19674] fix, backported. 

* Browse through your bundled plugins folder should be <confluence_isntall>\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence\setup\atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip

* Unzip the files under a known location, locate OfficeConnector-1.*.jar save a copy, and delete it.

* Download [OfficeConnector-1.6.2.jar|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/221?versionId=24952] and place inside this location.

* Zip this folder ( DO NOT ZIP THE FOLDER, ONLY THE FILES INSIDE IT, THE ZIP MUST NOT CONTAIN FOLDERS)

* Rename to atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip
fields.summary: Office Connector Freezes Confluence When Loading Excel 2007 File With Date Macro

fields.description:
* Type text on a line
* Type text on the second line, and press Ctrl+Shift+K to link it

When the link is inserted, the link will be moved to the first line.

fields.description:
* Use autocomplete to insert a link
* Press backspace to edit the link text within the RTE

The text is then unlinked.

This also occurs when the link is entered using any other method. 

This seems to be an existing issue, but it now that autocomplete is enabled for IE it causes a serious usability problem, hence the high priority.
fields.summary: Using backspace to delete the space after a link will unlink it in an IE browser

fields.description:
They look actually pretty horrible. I wouldn't mind a little strangeness, but it's a bit too much even for me :-)

I can see why the permissions screen is too wide, but for the others, it's really not clear why they bleed so far.

I'll give it a 3 for now, because it's "just" German.
fields.summary: Easy Reader admin screens don't work well in German

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18885].
  {panel}

During the custom database setup, if you happen to be installing a fresh Confluence into a schema that is already populated you are given a warning and a couple of options.  If you choose to go ahead and overwrite the existing data, all of the jdbc url parameters that were configured in the previous screen are ignored.

- Select External Database
- Select MySQL
- JDBC Connection
- update the url to something like 'jdbc:mysql://localhost/conf312?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8'
- Click through to next page and then click the 'Overwrite' link

The entry in confluence.cfg.xml is now
<property name="hibernate.connection.url">jdbc:mysql://localhost/conf312?autoReconnect=true</property>

It's missing &useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8.  This is particularly frustrating if you are trying to force Confluence to use InnoDB tables via &sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB.
fields.summary: Setup Wizard - Overwriting Database does not carry over all jdbc parameters from the previous screen

fields.description:
When using the Rich Text editor in full screen mode, the Save and Cancel buttons are not visible.
You need to exit full screen to save your changes.  It would be more convenient if you did not have to do this.
The buttons could be added to the RH end of the toolbar when in full screen mode.
fields.summary: Cannot access Save and Cancel buttons when in RTE full screen mode

fields.description:
Using the Doc Import feature on a document that contains content withing brackets [ ] will throw an error if the content between the brackets contains a colon more than 256 characters after the opening bracket [.

Error from 3.1.1 on PostgreSQL (UTF-8) and MSSQL (UCS-2 with unicode fix implemented0:
{code}
org.springframework.transaction.IllegalTransactionStateException: Transaction is already completed - do not call commit or rollback more than once per transaction
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.rollback(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:725)
	at com.atlassian.xwork.interceptors.TransactionalInvocation.commitOrRollbackTransaction(TransactionalInvocation.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.xwork.interceptors.TransactionalInvocation.invokeInTransaction(TransactionalInvocation.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.xwork.interceptors.XWorkTransactionInterceptor.intercept(XWorkTransactionInterceptor.java:56)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
.....
{code}
fields.summary: Transaction error from colon placement when using Doc Import

fields.summary: Modz Detector is broken in 3.1.2

fields.description:
For internal users, they can access Confluence thru:
- http://s40atlasapp01:8080/securexwiki
- http://wiki (Apache which redirects to Tomcat)

For external use, we have set up 
- http://test.securex.eu/securexwiki
which points http://s40atlasapp01:8080/securexwiki


My server base url is http://s40atlasapp01:8080/securexwiki

The Edit in Office functionality works when I go via http://wiki 
or via http://s40atlasapp01:8080/securexwiki

Now I want it to work also when going via http://test.securex.eu/securexwiki
See screenshots attached.

I am using Windows XP SP3
Office 2003
Tested in IE6,7 and FF 3.5
fields.summary: Edit in Office fails when browsing via subdomain which is not the server-base-url

fields.description: If you try using the autocomplete as an anonymous user the trigger character doesn't work. If you try using the shortcut and delete the search text the dropdown disappears and the XHR response is a 404.
fields.summary: RTE Autocomplete doesn't work for anonymous users

fields.description:
For example, I may be entering a link inside parentheses or quote marks, etc.

In these cases, the automatic space is not wanted, and the user has to go back and delete it.

We should consider not adding the space in these cases, or even not at all.
fields.summary: Autocomplete: A space is automatically inserted after the link, but may not be wanted

fields.description:
Autocomplete is not triggered when the cursor is after an open parenthesis '('

I find this an annoying usability problem. It prevents me from easily entering a link inside the parentheses without using wiki markup.

A user is unlikely to want to actually type the string '(['.

Therefore: autocomplete should work after an open parenthesis.
fields.summary: Autocomplete: Unable to enter a link inside parentheses

fields.description:
When inserting an attachment link the href is something like confluence/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=819211&highlight=beesonflowers.pdf#foo+bar-attachment-beesonflowers.pdf in the RTE. 

It then *changes* to the download link for the rendered page.

This may be for a specific reason, or it may just be a bug. It should be investigated.
fields.summary: Links to attachments in the RTE use a different href to the one used when the page is rendered
Testability change required: Autocomplete tests should handle attachments href

fields.description:
See CONF-18870.

Tests for apostrophes in page and blog titles cannot be added due to apostrophe encoding not handled.

When this is done, testUserWithApostropheLink() can be uncommented (and should pass).
fields.summary: Testability change required: Autocomplete tests should handle apostrophes in page titles

fields.description:
Tests added for:
* Linking to users and to attachments
* Linking to pages and blogs with titles containing unicode characters
fields.summary: Additional Autocomplete tests

fields.description:

# Edit the page

The image should show up in the 'Insert Image' dialog

The image does not show up in the 'Insert Image' dialog and an error is written to the Confluence log.  Error below:

fields.description:
This is identical to the issue in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14018, however we have applied the patched jar file, atlassian-renderer-4.3.1-SNAPSHOT.jar, and this has not resolved the issue.

The bug can be replicated in Internet explorer 7 but not in Firefox 3.6

1. Create new page. In Wiki Markup mode input text, e.g.:

    One

    Two

Note: there is space between first and second lines.
2. Save this page.
3. Open this page in Rich Text mode and write some text into space between lines. E.g.:

    One
    Some text
    Two

4. Save and look at page now. The latter change was lost!

This is causing a great deal of frustration for our users so we would be grateful if it could be investigated.   Upgrading to a later version of confluence is also not an option for us at present
fields.summary: Edits done in Rich Text Editor are not saved when using IE 7

fields.description:
What happens is that I created my templates, including in them a link within the same page to the table of content of the page. I used the formula as per written on Confluence notation guide: "{ anchor : tableofcontent }" and "[  # table of content ]". As it was not working when creating a page whereas for the old page i created with the evaluation version it was actually working and i copy/paste them and the code remained the same and is still working.... This exact same code is not working for the new pages i am creating on the stable and latest version of Confluence......
Well, I stopped trying to understand that problem and tried other codes to make my internal links working for the new pages i was creating. The code I found was: "[ tableofcontent\ | # tableofcontent ]"(in wiki markup)
Hence it was working each time i was creating a page and when creating a page from a template.
When creating a page from a templates, the links appeared highlighted in red as: "tableofcontent|#tableofcontent" (in rich text mode) and then when i was saving it, links were working perfectly fine and showing the link as "tableofcontent/" in view mode (even though i didn't write any "\" when editing my code! I understood codes got automatically change to "tableofcontent\" when going back to the editing mode after saving) But links were working at least!....

BUT when I was creating my page from a template and was saving it without naming it, i had an error message telling me to name it AND my links got automatically changed to : "tableofcontent|#tableofcontent|" and then after naming my page and saving it, links were not working anymore and appeared as "[ tableofcontent | # tableofcontent \ | |]" in view mode, highlighted in red.
It is the same effect if I am creating a page from a template, i don't make any change except naming it, and switch from "rich text" to "wiki markup" and then back to "rich text", my links get automatically changed to " tableofcontent &#124 ; # tableofcontent ||" and are not working anymore after the page is saved and remain highlighted in red.

Whereas, if I am creating the page with a template, naming it and saving it right away, links are working. And if I am editing it again, than switch from "rich text" to "wiki markup" and back to "rich text" and saving it again, links are not changed and are still working perfectly fine!

Could you please help me to fix this bug??

Thanking you very much in advance..
fields.summary: [#TST-21496] Links to anchors are modified as bad links when editing a new page from a template if before saving you switched from rich text mode to wiki mode (even without making any change) and than saving the new page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18860].
  {panel}

Many spaces in our production sites are for test purpose (sandbox). These spaces are readable by every user authenticated.
The sandbox spaces comes always on top list when searching for something, because they are used a lot.
I would suggest to make an option on the Confluence admin indexing panel (see the attachment) to turn on/off the search indexing for space(s).
It would be easier to select all the spaces to be disabled or enter the keys...

The capacity of Confluence to deal with the search can be affected as the follwing scenario:

I'm searching for the word "house". When the search returns all the hits:

solution1: Confluence hides all the hits from Sandbox spaces - Lucene still index all the spaces but Confluence hides the sandbox spaces.

solution2: Lucene has never indexed the Sandbox spaces - Lucene has been commited to not index the Sandbox spaces.
fields.summary: Turn on/off indexing (for search purpose) on spaces
REST Search filtering on attachment niceType needs more acceptance tests
Removing a space violates a foreign key constraint on  table "content" from table "notifications"

fields.description:
Using the Doc Import on a word document with the following structure seems to throw the Doc Importer into a loop:

{noformat}
I. Section 1
II. Section 2
III. FAQ
I. Section 4
II. Section 5
III. FAQ
{noformat}

It appears stuck here:

{code}
"http-8080-5" daemon prio=1 tid=0x0a27a420 nid=0x478a runnable [0x768ca000..0x768cd0a0]
        at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:213)
        at com.benryan.dom.ImportTitleResolver.resolveTitle(ImportTitleResolver.java:67)
        at com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction.resolveTitleConflicts(WordImportAction.java:672)
        at com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction.doFileImport(WordImportAction.java:349)
        at com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction.executeFileImport(WordImportAction.java:158)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{code}

This is importing with Advanced Options with the option "Rename Duplicate Titles" checked with Split in 3 levels.

{noformat}
Office Connector plugin
Vendor: Atlassian Pty Ltd
Plugin Version: 1.6 (Studio)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Doc Import stuck in loop when duplicate titles are included in the Word Document

fields.description:
Changes made to a particular space's PDF stylesheet reflects on the others'. Hence, virtually every space is using the same PDF stylesheet.

Quoting [CSP-43577|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-43577] (restricted from public):

{quote}
* We have used a custom stylesheet for PDF exports that seemed to work fine so far. We copied this stylesheet to every space to ensure that the exported PDFs look the same for every space.
* When I change the stylesheet in one space, I see these changes in every other space.
* In some spaces, I can change the PDF stylesheet, but nothing happens. The PDF still uses an older stylesheet version. But it does not use the default stylesheet, even if I delete the stylesheet configuration completely.
{quote}

This behaviour does not appear in Confluence 3.1 (PDF Export Plugin v1.3)
fields.summary: Space's PDF stylesheet is not bound to a particular space anymore

fields.description: See screenshot.
fields.summary: "Get more" link on the personal space doesn't extend the box anymore, just flows outside of it.

fields.description: CONF-18684 needs the class for Office and PDF files, and this information is available at the time the AttachmentEntity is created in the REST service.

fields.description:
Since we have an article on it:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Node+in+cluster+does+not+rejoin+-+configure+a+cluster+without+multicast+traffic

We should be testing it.
fields.summary: Create a unicast cluster build plan

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# create a local user (testuser) in confluence and add the user to confluence administrator-group
# create a user with the same user name in ldap
# Restart confluence or flush the cache
# go to <your confluence address>/admin/users/domembersofgroupsearch.action?membersOfGroupTerm=confluence-administrator , you can see that the user (testuser) is in confluence-administrators group.
# if you click into the testuser you'll notice the user does not belong to the confluence-administrator group (as the LDAP user does not belong to confluence administrators group).

The problem is the confluence administrators group is displaying the local user, but when you click on the user, it fetches it from LDAP. This is confusing. 

If at step 3 you do not flush the confluence cache or restart, when you click into that user you will see the information for the local user instead (as it has been cached). This is expected when going through the confluence administrators group, but if you go directly via the manage users page, it will show the local users details, when you are expecting the LDAP users details.
fields.summary: duplicate username in confluence and ldap causes confluence to read group membership from local user instead of ldap user
Make the maxClauseCount configurable

fields.description:
I can't really explain why this happens or what makes this particular powerpoint file special, but it causes reindexing to hang at 99% in Confluence 3.0.2.  Confluence 3.1 indexes this file just fine.  It was not clear which file was killing the index until after I added a logging patch to help track down the hung indexer thread and the specific file.  The patch could probably be improved to reduce the amount of manual log parsing that you need to do afterwords.

Confluence 3.1 and 3.0.2 use different extractors/indexers so that's probably why it just works in 3.1.  Anyway...
fields.summary: Some powerpoint files can potentially hang indexing threads causing a full reindex to sit at 99% indefinitely
Shrink the JIRAIssue Macro if number of issues displayed is less

fields.description:
Currenty only 'edit page' has the Minor Change option. But this option is very important to have in all save/edit/delete operation, as my users complaints of too many notifications.

Operations that should have a 'Minor Change' options is:

-Add/Remove Attachements
-Add Page
-Remove Page
-Add Comment
-Edit Comment
-Remove Comment

I have 500 users in my company and the complaints are so strong, that the whole notification framework is almot unusable.

Please fix this.
fields.summary: No Notification option on every save operation

 -- referer: http://localhost:25555/admin/snipsnapimport-start.action | url: /admin/snipsnapimport.action | userName: admin | action: snipsnapimport

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)

	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy28.addMembership(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.snipsnap.SnipSnapImporter.importUser(SnipSnapImporter.java:217)

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy65.importAs(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.actions.ImportLongRunningTask.runInternal(ImportLongRunningTask.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:21)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
{noformat}

Current user appears to be not set correctly, causing permission check to fail when an admin is trying to import snipsnap users and groups.

The hack solution is to include:

        AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal.setUser(context.getCurrentUser());

in {{com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.snipsnap.SnipSnapImporter#doImport()}}.
fields.summary: Snipsnap importer does not set authenticated user correctly causing user import from snip snap wiki to fail

fields.description:
When scrolling using the keyboard in long lists, the behaviour should match that of a browser select list.

Two key interactions:

- The scrollbar should only move if the selection is at the bottom or top of the list. When it is at this location, it should scroll so as to reveal and select the next or previous list element.
- If I hold the an arrow key down, it should scroll through multiple items.
fields.summary: Links Browser: Scrolling in long lists should work in the same way as default browser controls

fields.description: At the moment with long lists in the links browser, the header scrolls out of view when looking at items lower down in the list. The header should be visible at all times.
fields.summary: Links Browser: Table header should be constant

fields.description: See screenshot. Small-screen/big form issue.
fields.summary: Template creation form breaks out of space admin page at 1024x768 or with Easy Reader applied
Attachment names with spaces are converted to '%20' in IE 8
Change move dialog to use the link dialog search approach

fields.description:
This only affects IE (only tested IE8) using the RTE.

Steps to replicate:
- Add some text to a page using the Rich Text Editor.  ie. "óóóóóóóóóóóóóóóó"
- Highlight the line of characters and then 'Insert/Edit Link'
- Create Link popup contains garbled characters for the 'Alias'. ie. "���������������������" (it's actually all squares in IE)
- Eventually when you get around to saving the link back to the page, the original text is replaced by the squares.
fields.summary: Insert Link incorrectly encodes alias

fields.description:
Hey,
We are currently using confluence version 2.8.0 and child pages that are moved within a spaces or between spaces are inheriting permissions from the older parent pages . 

Steps to reproduce : 

* Move a  child page from one location to another , within the space or between spaces and check the permissions . They inherit the older parent pages
fields.summary: Moved Pages still inherit old parent Page permissions

fields.description:
Hey,
We are currently using confluence version 2.8.0. However the issue reported through the ticket ID http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6505 has resurfaced for us again. We are able to view comments for the pages which we don't have access to , When we click the page to view it in the browser we get an error message "The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for."
We raised a separate thread at the Confluence forums and were advised to reindex and this has fixed the issue temporarily 

Steps to reproduce : 

* Create a test page under a space where "x" does not have access to 
* Add a comment to the page which brings up a feed to "x" about the new comment
fields.summary: I can see comments for the pages which i don't have access to
Allow PageTree (children) to be collapsed by default

fields.description:
* Disable the OC
* Edit a page containing an Office doc
* Type ! to get an autocomplete dropdown
* Select the Office doc

Nothing gets inserted into the editor. 

It would be good if we could prevent Office docs from being suggested if the OC plugin is disabled.
fields.summary: Autocomplete: Office docs are shown in the dropdown even when the Office Connector plugin is disabled

fields.description:
# Weird text swapping. Using the Rich Text Editor.
## Create a new link with text "Home" and link it to my space home page.
## Save the page.
## Edit the link by opening the links browser, but don't do anything. Just click "Insert".
## The text swaps to "SARAHTEST:Home".
!https://extranet.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/1818886300/BlitzTest4.png!
## Save the page. The text swaps to "Home" again.
!https://extranet.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/1818886300/BlitzTest5.png!
fields.summary: Links Browser: Weird text swapping

fields.description:
This is only the case when a link was inserted via the link browser in RTE and then edited. Editing existing links on the page correctly populate the link text field.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a link via the link browser in RTE
2. Place cursor in newly inserted link
3. Open link browser
fields.summary: The existing link text should appear by default in the "Link Text" box.

fields.description:
Possibly a duplicate? I believe you worked on something like this already...

To reproduce in video:
1. Type [ in the RTE
2. Select the search suggestion
3. Link browser should have opened. Search for something and link to it.
4. Click Insert. Link should have been inserted but wasn't.
fields.summary: Quick search from auto complete doesn't insert a link. See attached video

CTRL-SHIFT-B doesn't remove bullets across table cells

Use the status bar to provice feedback on actions that have no visible effect, like CTRL-SHIFT-C

expected CTR-SHIFT-V to insert row after not before
CTR-SHIFT-F doesn't maintain cursor position (moves cursor to beginning of page)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
1. Create table (default 3x4 will do)
2. Enter text in the first cell of any row
3. Arrow to next cell in row
4. Press CTRL-SHIFT-B

Bullet appears in current cell but cursor positioned in the next cell
fields.summary: CTR-SHIFT-B in table cell adds bullet to cell containing cursor but also moves the cursor to the next cell to the right (so you have to navigate back to the original cell to add bulletted text)
Ctrl-Shift-F bring up 'InPrivate Filtering' in MSIE8
Selecting multiple table cells - Bullets/Numbering - Hotkey doesn't remove Bullets/Numbering - Works for single cell
